summary: This is the sealed federal indictment filed against Jeffrey Epstein on July 2, 2019, in the Southern District of New York. It charges Epstein with one count of sex trafficking conspiracy and one count of sex trafficking, detailing a scheme from 2002-2005 to sexually exploit dozens of minor girls at his residences in Manhattan and Palm Beach, using a network of employees and victim-recruiters.

connections.description: Epstein directed Employee-1, a New York-based employee, to communicate with victims via phone to arrange sexual encounters at the New York Residence.
Epstein arranged for Employee-2, an assistant, to contact victims to schedule encounters at the Palm Beach Residence, including calls made from New York.
Employee-3, an assistant, was responsible for scheduling sexual encounters with minor victims at the Palm Beach Residence.
Epstein sexually abused Minor Victim-1 repeatedly at the New York Residence from around 2002, paid her, and encouraged her to recruit other girls.
Epstein sexually abused Minor Victim-2 repeatedly at the Palm Beach Residence from around 2004, paid her, and encouraged her to recruit other girls.
Epstein sexually abused Minor Victim-3 repeatedly at the Palm Beach Residence from around 2005, paid her, asked her age, and encouraged her to recruit other girls.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein is charged with sex trafficking conspiracy and sex trafficking for exploiting dozens of minor girls, some as young as 14, from at least 2002 to 2005.
Epstein operated a network using employees (Employee-1, Employee-2, Employee-3) to schedule encounters and victim-recruiters to bring new minors to his residences in New York and Florida.
The indictment details a consistent pattern: victims were recruited for 'massages' which escalated into sexual acts, for which they were paid hundreds of dollars in cash per encounter.
Epstein knew victims were underage, as some explicitly told him their age, and he incentivized victims to recruit others by paying them for each new girl brought to him.
The government seeks forfeiture of property used in the offenses, specifically Epstein's mansion at 9 East 71st Street in New York, owned by Maple, Inc.
